subject: Management
title: Active Listening Under Fire
description: Learn Active Listening Under Fire in one minute.

hook.text: During a heated review, the manager was already forming her rebuttal while the employee was still talking.

buildup.text: In conflict, listening stops. Both sides broadcast. Nobody receives.

discovery.text: Active listening means pausing your agenda to fully absorb what the other person is saying.

twist.text: Repeating back what you heard isn't agreement. It's proof that you listened. That alone de-escalates.

climax.text: So what I'm hearing isâ€¦ Is that right? These eight words can defuse almost anything.

punchline.text: People don't need you to agree. They need you to hear.

quiz.question: What is the key benefit of active listening during conflict?
options: It de-escalates tension by showing the other person they are heard
It helps you build a stronger counter-argument
It proves that you agree with the other person's position
